attributes.action: Ensure TIA (mini-stroke) patients get a brain scan ASAP
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: TIAs (mini strokes) can recur, or a full stroke take place. A medical team needs to know what is going on in the brain so they can treat it properly, before another (maybe worse) event happens. Surely it is vital for such patients  to get a brain scan ASAP? (See NICE guidelines). Is a 19 day wait for a brain scan at a TIA clinic safe or acceptable?
